title: `forge snapshot` leads to `Error: Process completed with exit code 1.` in CI Pipeline
body:
### Component

Forge

### Have you ensured that all of these are up to date?

- [X] Foundry
- [X] Foundryup

### What version of Foundry are you on?

`forge 0.2.0 (58a2729 2023-05-14T00:12:37.172762039Z)`

### What command(s) is the bug in?

`NO_COLOR=1 forge snapshot`

### Operating System

Linux

### Describe the bug

Since around 3 days (to be clear I haven't touched the config file for weeks), my CI pipeline that runs `NO_COLOR=1 forge snapshot >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY` fails. See, e.g., [here](https://github.com/pcaversaccio/snekmate/actions/runs/4968303390/jobs/8896022248#step:13:9):

```bash
Run NO_COLOR=1 forge snapshot >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
  NO_COLOR=1 forge snapshot >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
  shell: /usr/bin/bash -e {0}
  env:
    pythonLocation: /opt/hostedtoolcache/Python/3.[10](https://github.com/pcaversaccio/snekmate/actions/runs/4968303390/jobs/8896022248#step:13:10).[11](https://github.com/pcaversaccio/snekmate/actions/runs/4968303390/jobs/8896022248#step:13:11)/x64
    PKG_CONFIG_PATH: /opt/hostedtoolcache/Python/3.10.11/x64/lib/pkgconfig
    Python_ROOT_DIR: /opt/hostedtoolcache/Python/3.10.11/x64
    Python2_ROOT_DIR: /opt/hostedtoolcache/Python/3.10.11/x64
    Python3_ROOT_DIR: /opt/hostedtoolcache/Python/3.10.11/x64
    LD_LIBRARY_PATH: /opt/hostedtoolcache/Python/3.10.11/x64/lib
    MSYS: winsymlinks:nativestrict
    FOUNDRY_PROFILE: default
##[debug]/usr/bin/bash -e /home/runner/work/_temp/6026398d-bedb-492f-b779-75c8bc99a7[22](https://github.com/pcaversaccio/snekmate/actions/runs/4968303390/jobs/8896022248#step:13:23).sh
Error: Process completed with exit code 1.
##[debug]Finishing: Run snapshot
```

Am not 100% sure whether it's a Foundry or GitHub issue. However, I saw some weird deprecation warnings for escape sequences that could lead to this error when I run `forge snapshot` locally; an excerpt:

```
Running 2 tests for test/tokens/ERC721.t.sol:ERC721Invariants
[PASS] invariantOwner() (runs: 256, calls: 3840, reverts: 3449)
[PASS] invariantTotalSupply() (runs: 256, calls: 3840, reverts: 3449)
Test result: ok. 2 passed; 0 failed; finished in 18.23s
2023-05-14T09:45:06.358547Z ERROR foundry_evm::executor::inspector::cheatcodes::ext: stderr err="<unknown>:302: DeprecationWarning: invalid escape sequence \\{\n<unknown>:686: DeprecationWarning: invalid escape sequence \\{\n<unknown>:302: DeprecationWarning: invalid escape sequence \\{\n<unknown>:686: DeprecationWarning: invalid escape sequence \\{\n<unknown>:50: DeprecationWarning: invalid escape sequence \\{\n<unknown>:50: DeprecationWarning: invalid escape sequence \\{\n"

Running 1 test for test/auth/Ownable.t.sol:OwnableInvariants
[PASS] invariantOwner() (runs: 256, calls: 3840, reverts: 3840)
Test result: ok. 1 passed; 0 failed; finished in 1.79s

Running 36 tests for test/utils/Math.t.sol:MathTest
[PASS] testCbrtRoundDown() (gas: 46452)
[PASS] testCbrtRoundUp() (gas: 47200)
[PASS] testCeilDiv() (gas: 12728)
[PASS] testFuzzCbrt(uint256,bool) (runs: 256, μ: 19634, ~: 19316)
[PASS] testFuzzCeilDiv(uint256,uint256) (runs: 256, μ: 9025, ~: 9042)
[PASS] testFuzzInt256Average(int256,int256) (runs: 256, μ: 5598, ~: 5598)
[PASS] testFuzzIsNegative(int256) (runs: 256, μ: 5705, ~: 5705)
[PASS] testFuzzLog10(uint256,bool) (runs: 256, μ: 7198, ~: 7419)
[PASS] testFuzzLog2(uint256,bool) (runs: 256, μ: 7131, ~: 7256)
[PASS] testFuzzLog256(uint256,bool) (runs: 256, μ: 7183, ~: 7401)
[PASS] testFuzzMulDiv(uint256,uint256,uint256) (runs: 256, μ: 13043, ~: 12802)
[PASS] testFuzzMulDivDomain(uint256,uint256,uint256) (runs: 256, μ: 10652, ~: 10728)
[PASS] testFuzzUint256Average(uint256,uint256) (runs: 256, μ: 5782, ~: 5782)
[PASS] testFuzzWadCbrt(uint256) (runs: 256, μ: 19316, ~: 19010)
[PASS] testFuzzWadExp(int256) (runs: 256, μ: 15516, ~: 15628)
[PASS] testFuzzWadLn(int256) (runs: 256, μ: 17186, ~: 16964)
[PASS] testInt256Average() (gas: 12140)
[PASS] testIsNegative() (gas: 10674)
[PASS] testLog10RoundDown() (gas: 19351)
[PASS] testLog10RoundUp() (gas: 20396)
[PASS] testLog256RoundDown() (gas: 16126)
[PASS] testLog256RoundUp() (gas: 17045)
[PASS] testLog2RoundDown() (gas: 19000)
[PASS] testLog2RoundUp() (gas: 19813)
[PASS] testMulDivDivisionByZero() (gas: 10561)
[PASS] testMulDivOverflow() (gas: 10906)
[PASS] testMulDivRoundDownLargeValues() (gas: 13007)
[PASS] testMulDivRoundDownSmallValues() (gas: 7917)
[PASS] testMulDivRoundUpLargeValues() (gas: 13224)
[PASS] testMulDivRoundUpSmallValues() (gas: 8115)
[PASS] testUint256Average() (gas: 8288)
[PASS] testWadCbrt() (gas: 44758)
[PASS] testWadExp() (gas: 28737)
[PASS] testWadExpOverflow() (gas: 10691)
[PASS] testWadLn() (gas: 28106)
[PASS] testWadLnNegativeValues() (gas: 10583)
Test result: ok. 36 passed; 0 failed; finished in 10.75s
2023-05-14T09:45:31.832605Z ERROR foundry_evm::executor::inspector::cheatcodes::ext: stderr err="<unknown>:302: DeprecationWarning: invalid escape sequence \\{\n<unknown>:686: DeprecationWarning: invalid escape sequence \\{\n<unknown>:302: DeprecationWarning: invalid escape sequence \\{\n<unknown>:686: DeprecationWarning: invalid escape sequence \\{\n<unknown>:50: DeprecationWarning: invalid escape sequence \\{\n<unknown>:50: DeprecationWarning: invalid escape sequence \\{\n"

Running 2 tests for test/tokens/ERC20.t.sol:ERC20Invariants
[PASS] invariantOwner() (runs: 256, calls: 3840, reverts: 3132)
[PASS] invariantTotalSupply() (runs: 256, calls: 3840, reverts: 3132)
Test result: ok. 2 passed; 0 failed; finished in 13.35s
2023-05-14T09:45:45.226025Z ERROR foundry_evm::executor::inspector::cheatcodes::ext: stderr err="<unknown>:302: DeprecationWarning: invalid escape sequence \\{\n<unknown>:686: DeprecationWarning: invalid escape sequence \\{\n<unknown>:302: DeprecationWarning: invalid escape sequence \\{\n<unknown>:686: DeprecationWarning: invalid escape sequence \\{\n<unknown>:50: DeprecationWarning: invalid escape sequence \\{\n<unknown>:50: DeprecationWarning: invalid escape sequence \\{\n"
2023-05-14T09:45:58.819327Z ERROR foundry_evm::executor::inspector::cheatcodes::ext: stderr err="<unknown>:302: DeprecationWarning: invalid escape sequence \\{\n<unknown>:686: DeprecationWarning: invalid escape sequence \\{\n<unknown>:302: DeprecationWarning: invalid escape sequence \\{\n<unknown>:686: DeprecationWarning: invalid escape sequence \\{\n<unknown>:50: DeprecationWarning: invalid escape sequence \\{\n<unknown>:50: DeprecationWarning: invalid escape sequence \\{\n"
```

In order to replicate this behaviour, simply clone my repo [here](https://github.com/pcaversaccio/snekmate).

Hmm, just reproduced the issue and can see the `invalid escape sequence` warnings—however, I had to comment the `testFuzzTransferFrom` test for it to pass—it seems that test is broken? If i comment it, `forge snapshot` works fine.

Hmm, I don't think that test is broken tbh. Let's make quickly a deep-dive. If you run `forge test` you will see e.g. the output of `Create2Address.t.sol:Create2AddressTest` will look like this (that test contract has no `testFuzzTransferFrom` just saying):

```bash
Running 4 tests for test/utils/Create2Address.t.sol:Create2AddressTest
[PASS] testComputeAddress() (gas: 702919)
[PASS] testComputeAddressSelf() (gas: 711250)
[PASS] testFuzzComputeAddress(bytes32,address) (runs: 256, μ: 703452, ~: 703452)
[PASS] testFuzzComputeAddressSelf(bytes32) (runs: 256, μ: 711274, ~: 711274)
Test result: ok. 4 passed; 0 failed; finished in 1.30s
2023-05-16T07:24:55.336074Z ERROR foundry_evm::executor::inspector::cheatcodes::ext: stderr err="<unknown>:302: DeprecationWarning: invalid escape sequence \\{\n<unknown>:686: DeprecationWarning: invalid escape sequence \\{\n<unknown>:302: DeprecationWarning: invalid escape sequence \\{\n<unknown>:686: DeprecationWarning: invalid escape sequence \\{\n<unknown>:50: DeprecationWarning: invalid escape sequence \\{\n<unknown>:50: DeprecationWarning: invalid escape sequence \\{\n"
```

or `BatchDistributor.t.sol:BatchDistributorTest` (that test contract has no `testFuzzTransferFrom` again):

```
Running 12 tests for test/utils/BatchDistributor.t.sol:BatchDistributorTest
[PASS] testDistributeEtherMultipleAddressesSuccess() (gas: 149962)
[PASS] testDistributeEtherOneAddressSuccess() (gas: 76404)
[PASS] testDistributeEtherRevertWithInsufficientFunds() (gas: 80787)
[PASS] testDistributeEtherRevertWithNoFallbackFunctionForMsgSender() (gas: 156583)
[PASS] testDistributeEtherRevertWithNoFallbackFunctionForReceipt() (gas: 51834)
[PASS] testDistributeEtherSendsBackExcessiveEther() (gas: 185155)
[PASS] testDistributeTokenMultipleAddressesSuccess() (gas: 764652)
[PASS] testDistributeTokenOneAddressSuccess() (gas: 727265)
[PASS] testDistributeTokenRevertWithInsufficientAllowance() (gas: 721109)
[PASS] testDistributeTokenRevertWithInsufficientBalance() (gas: 723840)
[PASS] testFuzzDistributeEtherMultipleAddressesSuccess(((address,uint256)[]),uint256) (runs: 256, μ: 1025798, ~: 1003880)
[PASS] testFuzzDistributeTokenMultipleAddressesSuccess(((address,uint256)[]),address,uint256) (runs: 256, μ: 1513342, ~: 1549592)
Test result: ok. 12 passed; 0 failed; finished in 9.10s
2023-05-16T07:24:27.301540Z ERROR foundry_evm::executor::inspector::cheatcodes::ext: stderr err="<unknown>:302: DeprecationWarning: invalid escape sequence \\{\n<unknown>:686: DeprecationWarning: invalid escape sequence \\{\n<unknown>:302: DeprecationWarning: invalid escape sequence \\{\n<unknown>:686: DeprecationWarning: invalid escape sequence \\{\n<unknown>:50: DeprecationWarning: invalid escape sequence \\{\n<unknown>:50: DeprecationWarning: invalid escape sequence \\{\n"
```

If you check the test functions they don't have anything exotic in it. Also, take a look at this run from _last_ week (Mon, 8 May 2023): https://github.com/pcaversaccio/snekmate/actions/runs/4919886178. The summary contains no warnings at all. After that all the test runs contain these warnings. I.e. something has been introduced over the course of the last days that trigger these warnings.
That is the stderr of an FFI call you're doing, not a foundry warning

> That is the stderr of an FFI call you're doing, not a foundry warning

I'm doing FFI calls but not as part of the tests where this warning is issued...

I think the CI exit error is indeed triggered by a weird fuzz bug (as pointed out by @Evalir) which leads to the revert of one of the tests (Foundry uses an already deployed contract as an argument, will fix this via an additional `assume`). But the warnings will be still there...

You're running `vyper` on each test setup.

After adding some more debug info

```log
2023-05-16T08:35:28.937971Z ERROR apply:ext: foundry_evm::executor::inspector::cheatcodes::ext: args=["vyper", "src/tokens/ERC1155.vy"] stderr=...
```

and sure enough if you run `vyper src/tokens/ERC1155.vy`:

```log
$ vyper src/tokens/ERC1155.vy
<unknown>:302: DeprecationWarning: invalid escape sequence '\{'
<unknown>:686: DeprecationWarning: invalid escape sequence '\{'
<unknown>:302: DeprecationWarning: invalid escape sequence '\{'
<unknown>:686: DeprecationWarning: invalid escape sequence '\{'
<unknown>:50: DeprecationWarning: invalid escape sequence '\{'
<unknown>:50: DeprecationWarning: invalid escape sequence '\{'
```

I don't know about the CI fails tho

That's interesting, in this case I know what triggers the warnings, my PR here https://github.com/pcaversaccio/snekmate/pull/109. Let me quickly fix this as well as the `assume` issue in the fuzz test and will report back.

Fixed the errors via https://github.com/pcaversaccio/snekmate/pull/115. To fix the fuzz error (which again chose an unfortunate but valid value; see my general issue on this topic https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry/issues/4318) I had to add `owner != makeAddr("receiver")` in my `assume`.
